SEARCH

Class Graph

java.lang.Object
Graph
public class Graph extends Object
Represents a weighted graph with functionality to add edges, compute shortest paths, and retrieve distances between vertices. The graph is represented internally as an adjacency list and a separate map for weighted edges. It includes methods for edge manipulation, pathfinding via Dijkstra's algorithm, and memory management for large graphs by removing half the entries from inner maps when necessary. The Edge inner class is used to represent connections between vertices along with their respective weights and provides a natural ordering of edges based on these weights. The Graph class also supports precomputed distances between vertices for efficient distance retrieval. It offers methods to add and retrieve individual edge weights, as well as to compute shortest paths and overall distances between given vertices. Usage of this class involves creating a Graph instance, adding edges with associated weights, and then querying for shortest paths or distances as needed. The class provides a toString method for easy visualization of the graph's structure in terms of vertex connections and edge counts.

  • Method Details

    • removeHalfFromEachInnerMap

      public void removeHalfFromEachInnerMap()
      Removes half of the entries from each inner map in the weightedMap. It's used to manage memory consumption for large graphs.

    • addWeight

      public void addWeight(int from, int to, double weight)
      Adds or updates the weight for an edge between two vertices.
      Parameters:
      from - The starting vertex identifier.
      to - The ending vertex identifier.
      weight - The weight of the edge.

    • getPrecomputedValue

      public double getPrecomputedValue(int src, int dest)
      Retrieves a precomputed weight value between two vertices.
      Parameters:
      src - The source vertex.
      dest - The destination vertex.
      Returns:
      The weight of the edge if it exists, otherwise -1.0.

    • shortestPath

      public ArrayList<Integer> shortestPath(int src, int dest)
      Computes the shortest path between two vertices using Dijkstra's algorithm.
      Parameters:
      src - The source vertex identifier.
      dest - The destination vertex identifier.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of integers representing the path from source to destination.

    • getDistance

      public double getDistance(int src, int dest)
      Calculates the distance between two vertices in the graph. It may use precomputed values or compute the path if necessary.
      Parameters:
      src - The source vertex.
      dest - The destination vertex.
      Returns:
      The distance between the source and destination vertices.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the graph.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string that lists all vertices and their edge counts.
